issue.title: Unable to run docker container for wireshark
issue.body:
Hello

I'm unable to run oqs-wireshark as a docker container.

I have used the below command, which is specified in the README,

```
docker run --net=host --privileged --env="DISPLAY" --volume="$HOME/.Xauthority:/root/.Xauthority:rw" openquantumsafe/wireshark
```


And I'm getting this error,

```
No protocol specified
21:23:24.408     Main Warn could not connect to display :0
21:23:24.408     Main Info Could not load the Qt platform plugin "xcb" in "" even though it was found.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

Kindly please help me with this error.

Thanks in advance.

comment.body:
Please provide information about the platform this docker image is executed on (`uname -a && cat /etc/os-release && xdpyinfo`): At first glance, the error message seems to indicate the execution environment to not have X and/or Qt available as per https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-demos/blob/main/wireshark/USAGE.md :

> The image is based on Ubuntu and requires the host to run the Unix X-Window system.

issue.title: `test_non_executable_stack` fails on mips* and hppa architectures

comment.body:
This is indeed a [new test](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/commit/a34cabb4bf4a941fb0b82d447d8836fba4561171).

Is it possible that the compiler flag "-Wa,--noexecstack" is not properly honored on those platforms? I don't have any of those at my disposal to test. If you could confirm this, would you want to set `--ignore=tests/test_binary.py` when invoking `pytest`? Alternatively, can you propose "carve-out" statements that we could add to skip that test on those specific platforms?

issue.title: Unable to run docker container for wireshark
issue.body:
Hello

I'm unable to run oqs-wireshark as a docker container.

I have used the below command, which is specified in the README,

```
docker run --net=host --privileged --env="DISPLAY" --volume="$HOME/.Xauthority:/root/.Xauthority:rw" openquantumsafe/wireshark
```


And I'm getting this error,

```
No protocol specified
21:23:24.408     Main Warn could not connect to display :0
21:23:24.408     Main Info Could not load the Qt platform plugin "xcb" in "" even though it was found.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

Kindly please help me with this error.

Thanks in advance.

comment.body: Thanks for that reconfirmation: Indeed, from an X-window perspective, if the oqs-epiphany image works, oqs-wireshark should work, too... But then again, oqs-wireshark needs root-rights to "go promiscuous" and therefore is "special"... The one idea I could propose is that you play around with the env var DISPLAY; maybe explicitly set it to the _full-ip-address_:0 of your test VM. You might also want to log into the running container, `apt install x11-apps` and see whether you can start those, e.g., `xeyes`. I expect you can't, indicating this is a problem with your specific root-UID-container-in-userID-VM-over-Windows setup for the X-Windows system: Sorry I cannot reproduce that to help more :-(

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

## Example for picnic_L1_FS

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
```

comment.body:
> Looks like @sebastinas is already on top of things in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1280. 

Maybe @sebastinas only worried about picnic(base), not picnic3? Could either of you please check/retest again, @christianpaquin ? Maybe I did something wrong...

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

comment.body: It's the different code paths the SHA3 implementation takes (AVX2 vs opt64). I'll update the suppression files.

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

## Example for picnic_L1_FS

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
```

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

## Example for picnic_L1_FS

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
```

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

## Example for picnic_L1_FS

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
```

comment.body:
>  this would all be a lot easier if declassification of certain values would be possible then we would need to play whack-a-mole with the suppression files.

We have the declassification macros in tests/test_kem.c:

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/d3c10161e3b13bf9352ad4e53dddfde955b04c71/tests/test_kem.c#L14-L21

I guess it would be possible to use macros in the Picnic code to do declassification when the appropriate `#ifdef` is set...

issue.title: Picnic failing constant time tests
issue.body:
In preparation for the 0.7.2 release, I ran the Valgrind constant time tests. Picnic is failing them. It seems all Picnic variants fail.  We previously had suppression files in `tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic` and `.../picnic3` but something must have changed in the Picnic implementation that makes those suppressions no longer match.
[failures.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/9264526/failures.txt)


To reproduce:
```bash
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Classic*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,Rainbow*,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

This yields the output in the attached file, with a few excerpts below

```
. > valgrind --tool=memcheck --gen-suppressions=all --error-exitcode=1 --max-stackframe=20480000 --num-callers=20 --suppressions=tests/constant_time/sig/passes/picnic ./build/tests/test_sig picnic_L1_FS
```

issue.title: Unable to run docker container for wireshark
issue.body:
Hello

I'm unable to run oqs-wireshark as a docker container.

I have used the below command, which is specified in the README,

```
docker run --net=host --privileged --env="DISPLAY" --volume="$HOME/.Xauthority:/root/.Xauthority:rw" openquantumsafe/wireshark
```


And I'm getting this error,

```
No protocol specified
21:23:24.408     Main Warn could not connect to display :0
21:23:24.408     Main Info Could not load the Qt platform plugin "xcb" in "" even though it was found.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

Kindly please help me with this error.

Thanks in advance.

comment.body:
Thanks for your response!

I'll try the options mentioned above and will see, if I can fix this error.
